intro: Streptanthus morrisonii, commonly known as Morrison's whitlow grass, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers in clusters, which bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has a compact growth habit and is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
